text: this year take a bite out of Halloween
with vampire lips it's a fun snack for
the kids and you'll have fun making them
too all you need are an apple mini
marshmallows creamy peanut butter and
blanched almonds four fangs first core
the Apple I like to just cut cheeks
around the core just like that and then
these go into wedges about an inch to an
inch and a half thick this is not rocket
science so just use your eyeballs
nothing needs to be measured here you
can also do this with a red apple if you
like I like the way the green apples
taste and also look and again cut some
wedges and now the fun part
building the lips so take wedges open
them side by side and first peanut
butter a little bit on each side of the
wedge that and then just a little bit on
the top to act as a glue to hold the
whole thing together and if you prefer
you could use almond butter or any other
kind of nut butter you'd like and for
the teeth the little marshmallows just
line them up like soldiers right along
the edge of one of the apple wedges it
needs to have the peanut butter on it of
course because that's your glue and I
think I'm gonna put one more down here
are you starting to see the vampire lips
yet and now for the top just like that
and for the finishing touch
two little blanched almonds become the
vampire fangs and just insert the
rounded end of the almond at the top so
that that pointy bit of the almond is
your Fang this is also something you
could have the kids do with you I think
they would enjoy lining up these little
marshmallows again two little almonds
blanched
and there you have it a pair of
frightening ly delicious vampire lips
you
